meanings.sent1: She reintroduced the game to her friends after they forgot about it.
meanings.sent2: The teacher reintroduced the topic for further discussion in class.
meanings.sent3: The magician reintroduced the disappearing act, but this time with a twist.
meanings.sent4: The chef reintroduced the popular dish on the menu, much to the delight of customers.
meanings.sent5: The museum curator reintroduced the ancient artifact to the exhibit, drawing in many visitors.

meanings.definition: To bring (something) back into use or existence.
meanings.sent1: He reintroduced the old tradition of storytelling around the campfire.
meanings.sent2: The company reintroduced the classic design of their first product.
meanings.sent3: The gardener reintroduced the forgotten flower species into the garden, adding color and variety.
meanings.sent4: The author reintroduced the character from the first book in the sequel, creating a sense of nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The scientist reintroduced the experiment with a new approach, hoping for different results.
